sources.title: The Blue Max (1966) George Peppard · James Mason
sources.description: Western Front, 1918. An immensely ambitious German lieutenant from humble beginnings strives by all means to win the Pour le Mérite (which the English call " Blue Max "). When he violates "officer honor," his general sends him to his death in an unflyable aircraft.   A lavish war spectacle set in the fighter pilot milieu of the First World War, staged in the style of a dream factory. The aerial combat footage is a technical masterpiece for the time.

metadata.Plot: The tactics of a German fighter pilot offend his aristocratic comrades but win him his country's most honored medal, the Blue Max. The General finds him useful as a hero even though his wife also finds him useful as a love object. In the end the General arranges for him to test-fly an untried fighter.
metadata.Writer: Jack Hunter, Ben Barzman, Basilio Franchina
metadata.Actors: George Peppard, James Mason, Ursula Andress
metadata.Awards: Won 1 BAFTA Award1 win & 5 nominations total
